item.title: Between 23+25 around BT manhole, 24th July
item.description:
This work was completed in our road yesterday. Laying pipes for BT. But this manhole is now an accident waiting to happen. It is very sunken. Lethal to anyone on the pavement, walking, using zimmers or wheelchairs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders cars and vans blocking pavement daily, 24th July
item.description:
At Shire cars building site at the Shurdington end of Leckhampton Lane. Pavement blocked daily. Very hazardous for pedestrians when there is an empty car park on the main road at the George V playing field. This problems has been going on for at least 2 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed and no large Lorrieâ€™s sign unreadable, 23rd July
item.description:
The signs as you come into Uckington have faded and are unreadable. Please can they be replaced as these are leading to large vehicles coming through the village. Diversions are soon to be put in place on other roads which could lead to more traffic through Uckington and Elmstone Hardwicke so signs are needed asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Road signs faded and unreadable, 23rd July
item.description:
On the entrance to Elmstone Hardwicke the signs including no Lorrieâ€™s/Trucks over a certain tonnage are faded and unreadable. The road continues to Uckington which has its own signs that area also faded - I will report those separately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Aggressive cows, 23rd July
item.description:
Field next to St Paulâ€™s Church in Leckhampton on the Church Lane in Cheltenham. Field next to it has a Cotswold Way Walk for public right of way through the field. It goes up towards Leckhampton Hill

item.title: No cycling sign partly obscured by foliage, 23rd July
item.description:
Mini island at Green Lane and Drews Court. A footpath/alleyway leading from here going north down to the car park. The sign really needs to re-sited and bolted to the gate below where it will be clearly visible. Lots of lads just ride down the pathway at speed, they say they do see the existing sign! Accidents waiting to happen!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drews Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
